channel.title: Comments on: Yeshayahu Leibowitz in the SEP
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: John
item.dc:creator: John
item.description: I never understood why some people seemed to be in awe of Leibowitz. No doubt he was a great thinker and many times more intelligent than me. I did meet him and I did read his books and I always had the impression that his theology was profoundly not Jewish. Your text here seems to confirm it. I never felt any connection to his vision of Judaism that sounded to me very German and Christian-influenced.

item.title: By: Howard

item.description: So Leibowitz was a radical transcendentalist! Are you aware if he was in anyway influenced by any of the great American transcendentalists and if so can you point me to references that support this?
